Author: walkallover1991

Comment: It’s a case of Democrats learning the wrong lesson. She is probably saying to herself, “McAuliffe lost in 2021 after endorsing repealing of right-to-work laws, so I can’t do that.” That doesn’t make sense. Part of why McAullife lost in 2021 was his initial unwillingness to repeal right-to-work. The “parents have no rights” was a debacle, but an early embrace of restoring unions might have helped him overcome that error. Instead, he waited until summer, which was idiotic because he’d opposed a repeal in the past, and if one is going to change positions, announce it as quickly, as loudly, and as frequently as possible. His demurring or reverting to his anti-union position might have worked in the Virginia of 2004, 2008, or even 2012, but not in 2021. As the DC suburbs have grown, so has the Democratic Party base, and the base *likes* unions.   Since the base likes unions, Spanberger should support them. In the past, she has; Spanberger is someone who cosponsored the PRO Act. She should be embracing it, not running from it. It’s not enough to be anti-GOP if one isn’t showing voters that Democrats can make people’s lives significantly better. Unless she does so, she will lose, because even if her incremental plans are solid, the GOP’s derangement will suck all the air out of the room, so those plans won’t get attention; look at how some very good plans from the Harris campaign were buried by news about Trump. There is no way to overcome that without being a transformational progressive, and until Democrats realize that, they’ll continue to learn the wrong lessons.
Author: Brunt-FCA-285
